This report describes the typical weather at the Mohammed V International Airport (Casablanca, Morocco) weather station over the course of an average January. It is based on the historical records from 1974 to 2012. Earlier records are either unavailable or unreliable. Casablanca has a mediterranean climate with dry hot summers and mild winters. The area within 25 mi of this station is covered by croplands (79%), oceans and seas (11%), grasslands (4%), and forests (3%). The air is driest around January 30, at which time the relative humidity drops below 68% (mildly humid) three days out of four; it is most humid around January 9, rising above 93% (very humid) three days out of four.

The winter months in Casablanca never get truly cold, but temperatures in January can fall to 17 degrees during the day and 9 degrees at night, so it can feel comparatively cool. This is the quietest time of year in the city, and also the wettest-it rains on around 10 days a month now, but only for brief periods.
